definition: to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Several companies gang up to raise prices.
sentences.chinese: 幾家公司串通一氣擡高物價。

sentences.english: People always conspire to keep the truth from me.
sentences.chinese: 人們總是串通一氣不把真情告訴我。

sentences.english: I know who rides with Théoden of Rohan.
sentences.chinese: 我知道誰跟羅翰國的塞奧頓串通一氣。
